Title: Want Something？ First Let it Go ｜ Tao Te Ching Chapter 36 Explained

Content.Knowledge Point: The concept of Yin and Yang in Taoism
Content.Text: Yin and Yang is the Chinese philosophical concept of two opposite forces coexisting as different halves of the same whole. In Taoism, two opposite things are seen rather as two sides of the same coin, opposing forces that are complementary as a result of their opposition.

We never fully appreciate or understand something until we have first experienced its opposite. You never really understand what it means to have a partner that truly loves and sees you until you have had partners who did not, or you have spent a good deal of time alone.

In order to truly possess something, the best way to do this is to first be okay with not possessing it. If you need something so badly that you cannot reconcile yourself with not having it, you will never truly have that thing.

Content.Knowledge Point: Applying the concept to wealth and relationships
Content.Text: Many parents, through a combination of luck, work, and creativity, are able to amass a great deal of wealth over their lives, only to discover that their children, never having experienced poverty, are not truly able to experience wealth in any sustainable way.

Content.Knowledge Point: The peace that comes with acceptance
Content.Text: The peace that comes when you can accept and flow with the opposition in your life is real. If you can learn to do this, you will be able to truly have things in ways you have never been able to before.
